title: Sozopol
summary: Sozopol (Bulgarian: Созопол [soˈzɔpoɫ], Greek: Σωζόπολη, romanized: Sozopoli) is an ancient seaside town located 35 km south of Burgas on the southern Bulgarian Black Sea Coast. Today it is one of the major seaside resorts in the country, known for the Apollonia art and film festival (which takes place in early September) that is named after one of the town's ancient names.
